original_title: Sri Lanka foreign reserves to top US$4.0bn by end 2024
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s gross official reserves will exceed 4.0 billion US dollars with loans disbursed by several lending agencies, the Finance Ministry said.
Gross official reserves are made up of Treasury balances, usually from borrowings or asset sales, and also monetary reserves, bought by selling the central bank’s Treasuries holdings.
The Finance Ministry said 337 million dollars was disbursed by the International Monetary Fund on December 14, 200 million dollars by the Asian Development Bank on December 15.
The World Bank had disbursed another 250 million on December 20.
“The gross official reserves are expected to surpass US dollars 4.0 billion by end of 2023, a level higher than anticipated earlier,” the Finance Ministry said.
The Treasury reserves if used for domestic spending they will drive economic activity and imports (expand the current account gap).
If they are used for debt repayments current account will be unaffected and government debt will also remain the same.
End November gross official reserves were 3,584 million US dollars, up from 3,569 million dollars in October. (Colombo/Dec21/2023)
